title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: FTC chair warns Google about Gmail’s ‘partisan’ spam filters
items.description: FTC chairman Andrew Ferguson appears to be pursuing conservative complaints over Gmail's spam filters.

items.title: Director Jim Jarmusch ‘disappointed and disconcerted’ by Mubi’s funding from Sequoia
items.description: Veteran indie filmmaker Jim Jarmusch is the latest to criticize Mubi for taking money from Sequoia.

items.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility — your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation.

items.title: 41 Best Labor Day Sales on WIRED-Tested Gear (2025)
items.description: You labored hard for your cash—save some of it with these Labor Day deals on WIRED-approved fire pits, laptops, pizza ovens, and more.

items.title: Nvidia says two mystery customers accounted for 39% of Q2 revenue
items.description: Nearly 40% of Nvidia’s second quarter revenue came from just two companies, identified in a filing as "Customer A" and "Customer B."
